Class RobotArm

java.lang.Object
RobotArm
public class RobotArm extends Object
Represents a robot arm that selects and sorts Disks. Contains an arm, a Tower, and the doors for the Tower, as well as references to the InputLine and OutputLine to be modified/sorted. Will switch between a series of phases in order to carry out a series of steps necessary to sort the Disks. Can create a graphical representation of this RobotArm, which includes the arm, any Disk that the arm is currently carrying, the Tower, and the box with doors around the Tower.
Author:
Rory McGuire

  • Constructor Details

    • RobotArm

      public RobotArm(int x, int y, InputLine input, OutputLine output)
      Constructor for instantiating an object of type RobotArm. Instantiates all fields relative to the parameters sent to this constructor.
      Parameters:
      x - the x value of the RobotArm's origin position
      y - the y value of the RobotArm's origin position
      input - the InputLine to be used by the RobotArm
      output - the OutputLine to be used by the RobotArm

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws this RobotArm. Draws tower, the doors surrounding it, the arm, and the Disk the arm is holding.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object to be drawn upon

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the positions of this - to be called before each repaint(). Moves this a step toward completion of its task to sort InputLine in into OutputLine out. Depending upon the current phase that this is in, will move the arm or remove/add Stacks/Disks to in, out, or to tower as necessary.

    • processOneDisk

      public void processOneDisk()
      Decides which phase to begin next, then sets the variables necessary to begin that phase. Will determine whether to unload the next Disk, to unload tower, or to mark the progress as complete. To be called when phase == Phases.WAIT

    • completed

      public boolean completed()
      Will check and return whether the current phase is Phases.Done.
      Returns:
      whether the current phase is Phases.DONE (whether this is complete)

    • getTower

      public Tower getTower()
      Getter for this.Tower
      Returns:
      Tower
